result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey E Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 10-30-17; unpaid court obligations of $518 and supervision fees of $470
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Jeffrey E Smith in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendations agreed. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in jail. 221 days jail credit. A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligiations. May transfer to Dane County Jail with EMP. 3:14/3:17
Notice of 10/30/17 sentence hearing sent to defendant at Dane County Jail - returned - not deliverable.  Counsel to contact.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 30, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Revocation Order and Warrant and Violation/Revocation Summary filed by Probation Agent (forwarded to public defender office)
Judgment of Conviction mailed to defendat at Columbia Cty Jail, returned marked as inmate not in custody, unable to forward.
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief, with Voter Ineligibility Notice And Ackowledgment filed by defendant and Atty Riek

Defendant Jeffrey E Smith in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K Riek.  Brenda L Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty, judgment was entered.  Withhold sentencing placed on probation for 2 years.  60 days jail with Huber work release.  $268.00 costs, $250.00 DNA sample and surcharge.  AODA and comply with treatment.  Jail start date May 29, 2014  7:00pm.  Jail credit 50 days.
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Long
